original: "There rest they, nor their sequence change, nor place, / save when, by chance, on grating hinge the door / swings open, and a light breath sweeps the floor, / or rougher blasts the tender leaves disperse. / Loose then they flutter, for she recks no more / to call them back, and rearrange the verse; / untaught the votaries leave, the Sibyl's cave to curse."
translated: " Là, l'oracle repose et demeure immobile. / Mais si la porte, ouverte aux zéphyrs indiscrets, / de l'arrêt fugitif leur livre les secrets, / ils volent dispersés sous les roches profondes. / Elle, au lieu d'assembler leurs feuilles vagabondes, / de ses oracles vains aux vents abandonnés / laisse errer au hasard les mots désordonnés ; / et qui vient consulter sa réponse inutile, / maudit en s'éloignant l'antre de la sibylle. "

original: Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies, in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and not clothed. This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children.
translated: Chaque canon qui est fabriqué, chaque navire de guerre qui est lancé, chaque fusée mise à feu signifie, en définitive, un vol au détriment de ceux qui ont faim et ne sont pas nourris, de ceux qui ont froid et ne sont pas vêtus. Ce monde en armes n'est pas seulement une dépense d'argent. C'est la dépense de la sueur de ses travailleurs, du génie de ses scientifiques, des espoirs de ses enfants.

original: Using the algebraic notation system, each square on the board is identified by a letter and a number. The letters – from “a” to “h”, left to right of white's player – correspond to the vertical lines (columns). The numbers – from 1 to 8, also from the position of white – correspond to the horizontal lines (rows). For example, a checker on c5 is in the encounter of the 3rd column with the 5th row.
translated: En utilisant le système de notation algébrique, chaque case du damier est identifiée par une lettre et un chiffre. Les lettres – de « a » à « h », de gauche à droite du blanc – correspondent aux lignes verticales (colonnes). Les chiffres – de 1 à 8, également à partir de la position du blanc – correspondent aux lignes horizontales (rangées). Par exemple : une pièce sur c5 est à la rencontre de la 3ème colonne avec la 5ème rangée.

original: The United States intends to achieve an economy-wide target of reducing its emissions by 26%-28% below its 2005 level in 2025 and to make best efforts to reduce its emissions by 28%. China intends to achieve the peaking of CO₂ emissions around 2030 and to make best efforts to peak early and intends to increase the share of non-fossil fuels in primary energy consumption to around 20% by 2030.
translated: Les États-Unis entendent atteindre, d'ici à 2025, l’objectif de réduction de 26% à 28% de leurs émissions par rapport au niveau de 2005 pour l’ensemble de l’économie et entendent s'efforcer de réduire autant que possible leurs émissions de 28%. La Chine prévoit d'atteindre son pic des émissions de CO₂ vers 2030 ainsi que de déployer tous les efforts possibles pour atteindre son pic plus tôt et entend augmenter d'environ 20% la part des combustibles non fossiles dans la consommation d'énergie primaire à l'horizon 2030.

original: It's time to get started with the Christmas shopping.

original: They are both good.

original: Amnesia means "loss of memory".

original: I think I know why.

original: Telephone booths are very scarce around here.

original: Did you enjoy yourself last evening?

original: Are you feeling under the weather?

original: It seems like I'm speaking Chinese to you.

original: He has a maid.

original: Shut up and listen to him!

original: Stop being so silly!

original: Superstitions derive from the inability of men to acknowledge that coincidences are merely coincidences.
translated: Les superstitions proviennent de l'incapacité des hommes à reconnaître que des coïncidences sont simplement des coïncidences.

original: I brush my teeth after breakfast.

original: I must decide what to do.

original: Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or a picture or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
translated: Toute œuvre d'un homme, que ce soit littérature ou musique ou image ou architecture ou quoi que ce soit d'autre, est toujours un portrait de lui-même.

original: Everybody hates me.

original: Nobody forced you to help me.

original: Don't talk about people behind their backs.

original: Tom still studies French.

original: Tom said he didn't drink coffee.

original: We men are used to waiting for the women.

original: A fish swims by moving its tail.

original: Let's replace all of them.

original: This restaurant is pants.

original: He was absent from school yesterday.

translated: Il était si riche qu'il pouvait acheter n'importe quel tableau qui lui faisait envie.

original: It's necessary to avoid stress.

original: Everyone is free to contribute.

original: We're careful.

original: Stop talking and listen to me.

original: I have no religion.

original: My friend Marcelo writes in Latin.

translated: Pour les personnes qui comprennent quelque chose à propos de l'art, il n'y a pas besoin de mots. On dit "Hm!" "Ha!" ou "Ho!", et avec cela tout est exprimé.

original: The enquiry concluded that, despite his denials, the chief executive would have had to have known about the illegal practices occurring in the company.
translated: L'enquête conclut qu'en dépit de ses dénégations, le directeur général aurait eu connaissance des pratiques illégales, en cours dans l'entreprise.

original: This medicine will do you good.
translated: Ce médicament te fera du bien.

original: It isn't possible to get away from your problems.

original: Where did you go?

original: Happiness is a delicate flower.

original: This is how I made it.

original: "A return ticket Paris-Toulouse…" "That will be €40.37."
translated: « Un aller-retour Paris-Toulouse… » « Ça fera quarante euros et trente-sept centimes. »

original: Tom is at home with his wife.

original: It never gets old.

original: Everyone is outraged.

original: The evolution of dinosaurs interests me greatly.

translated: Si tous les insectes devaient disparaître de la Terre, toute forme de vie disparaîtrait de la Terre en cinquante ans. Si tous les êtres humains disparaissaient de la Terre, toute forme de vie s'épanouirait en cinquante ans.

original: I don't have the authority to order that.

original: You went pale.

original: Everyone likes you.

original: I didn't know that until this morning.

original: You speak.

original: Patience is essential for a teacher.

original: Don't forget to stir the stew.

original: He will be coming to the party.
translated: Il viendra à la fête.

original: They were like two ships that pass in the night.
translated: Ils étaient passés l'un à côté de l'autre.

original: The Americans had very little gunpowder.
translated: Les Étasuniens ne disposaient que de très peu de poudre à canon.

original: We should've set off earlier.
translated: Nous aurions dû partir plus tôt.

original: I will get it for you.
translated: Je l'aurai pour toi.

original: You were in the taxi, weren't you?
translated: Vous étiez dans le taxi, n'est-ce pas ?

original: There's nowhere to sit down.
translated: Il n'y a nulle part où s'asseoir.

original: It's not safe here.
translated: On n'est pas en sécurité, ici.

original: This book is worth reading again and again.
translated: Ce livre mérite d'être lu encore et encore.

original: She was wearing a thick coat against the chill.
translated: Elle portait un épais manteau contre le froid.

original: We're not friends, we're just coworkers.
translated: Nous ne sommes pas amis, nous sommes simplement collègues.

original: Thanks. I appreciate it.
translated: Merci. J'y suis sensible.

original: I found him a job.
translated: Je lui ai dégoté un emploi.

original: Do you feel bored?
translated: Tu t'ennuies ?

original: I didn't want to miss the party.
translated: Je ne veux pas rater la fête.

original: That's what I told her.
translated: C'est ce que je lui ai dit.

original: Where is the school?
translated: Où se trouve l'école ?

original: If for some reason that happened, what would you do?
translated: Si, pour une raison quelconque, cela arrivait, que ferais-tu ?

original: It isn't a difficult problem.
translated: Ce n'est pas un problème difficile.

original: That's his horse.
translated: C'est son cheval.

original: Where are they taking you?
translated: Où vous emmènent-elles ?

original: Maybe you should drink less.
translated: Tu devrais peut-être moins boire.

original: Listen up!
translated: Écoute-moi bien !

original: What he said might be true.
translated: Il se pourrait que ce qu'il a dit soit vrai.

original: This room is quiet.
translated: Cette chambre est calme.

original: I need a five-minute break.
translated: J'ai besoin d'une pause de cinq minutes.

original: I didn't get your name.
translated: Je n'ai pas retenu ton nom.

original: Brazil is the fifth biggest country in the world.
translated: Le Brésil est le cinquième plus grand pays au monde.

original: You had better make sure that he is at home before you call on him.
translated: Tu devrais être sûre qu'il est chez lui avant de lui rendre visite.

original: Tom suggests to Marie that he goes shopping while she watches the children.
translated: Tom propose à Marie d'aller faire les courses pendant qu'elle gardera les enfants.

original: His room is always tidy.
translated: Sa chambre est toujours rangée.

original: I'm still not used to getting up so early.
translated: Je ne suis toujours pas habitué à me lever si tôt.

original: He demanded better pay.
translated: Il exigea un meilleur traitement.

original: These aliens want to enslave humanity.
translated: Ces extraterrestres veulent asservir l'humanité.

original: Okay, Tom, that's enough!
translated: Bon, Tom, ça suffit comme ça !

original: I'll swim.
translated: Je nagerai.

original: Tom was very patient.
translated: Tom était très patient.

original: There are seven days in a week.
translated: Une semaine est composée de sept jours.

original: Radio is a great invention.
translated: La radio est une invention formidable.

original: Were I a bird, I would fly to you.
translated: Si j'étais un oiseau, je volerais vers toi.

original: Our boss doesn't tolerate being contradicted.
translated: Notre patron ne tolère pas qu'on le contredise.

original: Excuse me, but could you tell me how to get to Central Park?
translated: Excusez-moi mais, pouvez-vous m'indiquer comment se rendre à Central Park ?

original: Tom was wearing black leather gloves.
translated: Tom portait des gants de cuir noirs.

original: Do you know where she went?
translated: Sais-tu où elle est allée ?

original: A telephone recording tells you what time the concert starts.
translated: Un message téléphonique te dis à quelle heure commence le concert.

original: He gave me bread and milk.
translated: Il m'a donné du pain et du lait.

original: Are all of these people your friends?
translated: Tous ces gens sont-ils tes amis ?

original: Whom did you meet?
translated: Qui as-tu rencontré ?

original: Can't you do anything to stop them?
translated: Ne pouvez-vous rien faire pour les arrêter ?

original: Enjoy yourselves.
translated: Amusez-vous bien !

original: That is all that he said.
translated: C'est tout ce qu'il a dit.

original: The ball went one way and the goalkeeper went the other.
translated: Le ballon est allé dans un sens et le gardien de but dans l'autre.

original: I didn't know that I had to do that.
translated: Je ne savais pas que je devais faire ça.

original: I've been a bean.
translated: J'ai été un haricot.

original: I said so.
translated: Je l'ai dit.

original: I can read without glasses.
translated: Je peux lire sans lunettes.

original: The apple fell.
translated: La pomme tombait.

original: This is his letter, but it is not signed.
translated: C'est sa lettre, mais elle n'est pas signée.

original: Where is the scouring pad?
translated: Où est l'éponge à récurer ?

original: The author has a beautiful style.
translated: L'auteur a un beau style.

original: I've never seen anything like it.
translated: Je n'ai encore jamais rien vu de tel.

original: I was eating lunch when the phone rang.
translated: Je mangeais mon déjeuner quand le téléphone a sonné.

original: That's enough.
translated: C'en est assez !

original: Don't be so impatient.
translated: Ne sois pas si impatiente !

original: New hires are subject to careful monitoring in our firm.
translated: Les nouvelles embauches sont l'objet d'une supervision soigneuse, dans notre entreprise.

original: You're funny.
translated: T'es marrant.

original: She ignored him all day.
translated: Elle l'ignora toute la journée.

original: I suspect that Tom knows why Mary doesn't like him.
translated: Je soupçonne que Tom sait pourquoi Mary ne l'aime pas.

original: Aging doesn't cost anything.
translated: Prendre de l'âge ne coûte rien.

original: That was amazing.
translated: C'était génial.

original: How many bags do you have?
translated: Combien de sacs avez-vous ?

original: He told me that I must finish the work by six.
translated: Il m'a dit, que je dois finir mon travail à six heures.

original: I've been waiting for this for a year.
translated: Ça fait un an que j'attends ça.

original: Tom says he's been fired three times.
translated: Tom dit qu'il a été licencié trois fois.

original: There is a tall tree in front of my house.
translated: Il y a un grand arbre devant ma maison.

original: You can use Google Earth in VR, and I can assure you that it is mind-blowing.
translated: Vous pouvez utiliser Google Earth en VR, et je peux vous assurer que c'est époustouflant.

original: "Did you work yesterday?" "I wish yesterday had been a holiday."
translated: « As-tu travaillé hier ? » « Je souhaitais que hier fût un jour férié. »

original: Leave the lights on!
translated: Laisse les lumières allumées !

original: The narrower the mind, the bigger the asshole.
translated: Plus la cervelle est réduite, plus le trou du cul est gros.

original: I suppose you think I'm crazy.
translated: Je suppose que vous pensez que je suis fou.

original: Where's that music coming from?
translated: D'où vient cette musique ?

original: Handmade goods are very expensive nowadays.
translated: Les produits faits à la main sont très chers de nos jours.

original: Where is Poland?
translated: Où se trouve la Pologne ?

original: I think that this work is tiring.
translated: Je pense que ce travail est fatigant.

original: I was overwhelmed.
translated: J'étais bouleversé.

original: He is a painter.
translated: C'est un peintre.

original: Time is like a river; it does not return to its source.
translated: Le temps est comme un fleuve, il ne remonte pas à sa source.

original: Symmetry is boring.
translated: La symétrie est ennuyeuse.
